title: CMAES: Distributed population eval harness
description:
Goal: parallel candidate eval across 8+ GPUs with resume safety.
Subtasks:
- DDP/ProcessPool or Ray wrapper; device pinning.
- Error/timeout handling and retry.
- Smoke test pop=10 across 8 GPUs; wall time scales ~1/N.
acceptance_criteria: - Population eval dispatches to N GPUs with device pinning.\n- Failed/timeout jobs retried or reported without hanging run.\n- Pop=10 over 8 GPUs completes and wall time ~1/8 of serial.

title: CMAES: Stagnation/early-stop policy
description:
Goal: encode stagnation/early-stop rules into CMA-ES runs.
Subtasks:
- Implement check for <1% improvement over N gens; auto-stop or sigma reset.
- Log decisions in progress.jsonl and TB.
- Document defaults and how to override per run.
acceptance_criteria: - Early-stop/stagnation rules coded (<1% gain over N gens triggers stop or sigma reset).\n- Decisions logged in progress.jsonl/TB.\n- Docs on how to override parameters.

title: Epic: CMA-ES hyperparameter optimization
description: Epic covering objective mapping, distributed eval, monitoring, Phase1/Phase2 CMA-ES runs, sensitivity, integration, and budget tracking.
acceptance_criteria: - All CMA-ES program child tickets closed or descoped.\n- Epic summary documents achieved perplexity deltas, costs, and decisions.

title: Perf: Triton tuning for synaptic fused kernels
description:
Goal: retune Triton fused presyn/metrics/genetics kernels for 4090 SMs.
Subtasks:
- Autotune block sizes, num_warps, stages for Ada SM.
- Verify correctness vs reference; add perf guardrails.
- Record best configs; fallback selectors by arch.
acceptance_criteria: - Triton kernels retuned with autotune configs for Ada SM; best configs recorded.\n- Correctness tests vs reference pass; perf improvement quantified.\n- Fallback selection by arch implemented/documented.

title: CMAES: Monitoring + per-generation checkpoints
description:
Goal: TB scalars/hists, covariance heatmap, per-gen pickle/jsonl, resume flag.
Subtasks:
- progress.jsonl schema; best_params.json; per-gen pickle dump.
- CLI flags to enable/disable logging; docs.
acceptance_criteria: - TensorBoard logs scalars/hists and covariance heatmap per generation.\n- progress.jsonl and per-gen pickle written; resume works from last checkpoint.\n- Best_params.json updated on improvement.

title: Epic: Bio-inspired modular features
description: Epic covering new bio-inspired feature toggles (stochastic release, metaplasticity, dual weights, lifecycle, buffers, septin, Rab/SNARE, CaMKII/PP1 latch, Doc2 channels, genome embedding).
acceptance_criteria: - All child bio feature tickets closed or explicitly descoped.\n- Epic status reflects rollout notes and remaining risks, if any.

title: CMAES: Seed variance check
description:
Goal: measure seed variance of CMA-ES outcomes.
Subtasks:
- Run 2-3 short Phase1 runs with different seeds; record mean/std of best fitness.
- Report variance and recommend number of seeds for full runs.
- Add note to decision doc.
acceptance_criteria: - 2-3 short Phase1 runs with different seeds executed; mean/std of best fitness reported.\n- Variance noted; recommendation on seeds for full run recorded.

title: Eval: Feature ablation sweep
description:
Goal: run matrix toggling each bio feature individually vs vanilla.
Subtasks:
- Execute harness for each toggle on/off with fixed budget.
- Collect metrics from design matrix; store in single CSV.
- Track cost/runtime per run; note failures.
acceptance_criteria: - Ablation runs executed per feature toggle (on/off) with fixed budget and seeds.\n- Single CSV aggregates metrics for all ablations.\n- Failures/timeouts noted; cost/runtime recorded.

title: Data integrity for FineWeb downloads
description:
Goal: add checksum/size validation to dataset downloader.
Subtasks:
- Add optional checksums/sizes; verify after download; retry on mismatch.
- Log failures and keep .tmp cleanup.
- Doc flags and defaults.
acceptance_criteria: - Optional checksum/size validation added to dataset downloader; retries on mismatch.\n- Logs failures and cleans .tmp.\n- Docs note flags and defaults.

title: Run budgeting & logging
description:
Goal: track GPU-hours/$ for benchmarks, vis, perf runs (beyond CMA-ES).
Subtasks:
- Simple logger to append run_id, purpose, GPUs, hours, est $.
- Add to benchmark/perf/vis harnesses; doc how to use.
- Optional summary script.
acceptance_criteria: - Logger records run_id, purpose, GPUs, hours, est $; integrated into benchmark/perf/vis harnesses.\n- Summary script aggregates costs; docs tell how to log and view.

title: Perf: Dual-4090 multi-GPU efficiency (NCCL/P2P)
description:
Goal: optimize DDP/NCCL for dual 4090 over PCIe (no NVLink).
Subtasks:
- Tune NCCL env (P2P_LEVEL, SHM_DISABLE), bucket sizes, grad overlap.
- Verify P2P enabled; measure vs gdr/copy.
- Benchmark data loader/host pinning; ensure balanced GPU util.
- Document recommended launch flags.
acceptance_criteria: - NCCL env tuned and documented for PCIe-only dual 4090 (no NVLink).\n- P2P verified enabled; measured gain vs default; bucket/overlap settings recorded.\n- Data loader pinned and balanced; both GPUs show high, even util.

title: Vis: Pedagogical notebook/storybook
description:
Goal: create pedagogical notebook/storybook showing bio mechanisms in action.
Subtasks:
- Step-through demo with small model, visualizing states per token.
- Explainers for each bio feature (stochastic, BDNF, dual weights, lifecycle).
- Shareable HTML export; links to run configs.
acceptance_criteria: - Pedagogical notebook/storybook walks through small-model run showing bio states per token.\n- Includes explainers for each bio feature with visuals.\n- Exported shareable HTML; links to configs to reproduce.

title: CMAES: Execute Phase 1 (10D) and analyze

Goal: run 100 gens pop≈10 (10D search) plus 3 short-run seeds.

- Archive best_params.json; summarize val PPL and secondary metrics.

acceptance_criteria: - Phase1 10D run to 100 gens pop≈10 completes with logs archived.\n- Best_params.json + run summary recorded (val PPL + secondary metrics).\n- Compute cost documented; 3 short-run seed variance noted.

title: Bio: MoE lifecycle controller (health split/merge/reset)
description:
Goal: birth/death/merge based on health H=U*E without reallocating tensors.
Subtasks:
- Health metrics (utilization, energy efficiency); EMA.
- Split clone + noise; merge similar low-health; reset dead via stem template.
- Mask/index-map application; async cadence every N steps; hooks in splitmerge controller.
- Metrics: dead_expert_frac, lineage log; tests on toy MoE.
acceptance_criteria: - Health metric H tracked; split/merge/reset actions logged.\n- Toy MoE shows experts split and merge without tensor realloc errors.\n- Metrics (dead_expert_frac, lineage) appear in run logs.

title: CA init: design & plan
description:
Goal: plan controlled test of cellular-automata-based initialization vs Glorot.
Subtasks:
- Specify CA rules (30, 116), mapping to weight tensors, mean-centering/variance scaling (fan_avg).
- Identify layers to test (e.g., first linear per block, synaptic fast weights).
- Define metrics: loss curve, weight-sim decay, spectrum, early-step stability.
- Limit compute budget and stop criteria.
acceptance_criteria: - CA init plan documented: rules, mapping to tensors, variance scaling, target layers, metrics, compute cap, stop criteria.

title: Xpoll: Prototype simplicial / higher-order attention
description:
Goal: adapt MGR simplicial/higher-order attention ideas into bio model.

- Implement gated/optional path; small-scale test; measure quality/perf.
- Capture risks/complexity and recommendation.
acceptance_criteria: - Higher-order/simplicial attention variant prototyped behind flag.\n- Toy benchmark results captured (quality + perf).\n- Summary doc with risks/next steps.

title: Eval: Standardized run harness (bio/vanilla toggles)
description:
Goal: scripted harness to run benchmark matrix reproducibly.
Subtasks:
- CLI to choose preset (vanilla, bio-all, feature-ablations).
- Logs metrics to jsonl/CSV; saves checkpoints optional; seeds fixed.

- Outputs per-run summary (tokens, walltime, tok/s, PPL, NIAH, ECE).

title: CMAES: Sanity checks & toy convergence
description:
Goal: verify CMA-ES code path on cheap toy problems before expensive runs.
Subtasks:
- Run Rosenbrock 2D convergence test; assert near [1,1].
- Smoke-test single benchmark candidate eval with baseline params.
- Document pass/fail checklist before Phase 1 run.
acceptance_criteria: - Rosenbrock 2D CMA-ES converges near [1,1]; doc results.\n- Smoke-test single model eval path passes with baseline params.\n- Checklist recorded and must-pass before Phase1.
notes: Ready: run Rosenbrock test + smoke eval; gate Phase1 until this passes.

title: CMAES: Objective + param decoder for top-10 search
description:
Goal: standalone objective mapping vector->SynapticConfig for 10 key params.
Subtasks:
- Define bounds/log-vs-linear decoding.
- Seed control and reproducible baseline eval.
- CLI to run single eval for sanity.
acceptance_criteria: - CLI runs single candidate eval with fixed seed and prints metric.\n- Vector->config decoding covers 10 params with correct log/linear scaling.\n- Baseline eval matches documented reference within tolerance.

title: Perf: Inference fastpath (KV reuse + cudagraphs)
description:
Goal: lowest-latency inference path on 4090.
Subtasks:
- Optimize KV cache reuse, prefill batching, paged KV if helpful.
- Apply cudagraphs to steady-state decode; fallback for dynamic shapes.
- Measure prompt+decode latency and throughput; publish tuned defaults.
acceptance_criteria: - KV reuse path optimized (prefill + decode) with cudagraph steady-state option.\n- Latency/throughput benchmarks recorded; fallback path remains correct.\n- Recommended inference defaults documented for 4090.

title: CA init: micro-benchmark experiment
description:
Goal: run A/B micro-benchmark CA init vs Glorot.
Subtasks:
- Small model config; fixed seeds; 1-2 epochs on a subset task.
- Log loss curves, weight norm/spectrum, cosine similarity to init over steps.
- Evaluate early-step stability and any speedup.
- If similarity <5% by <200 steps and no metric gain, mark as no-impact.
acceptance_criteria: - A/B micro-benchmark run with fixed seeds; logs loss, norms, spectra, cosine-to-init over steps.\n- Early-step stability noted; similarity decay quantified (e.g., similarity <5% threshold).\n- Result CSV/plots saved.

title: Epic: Training visualization & insight
description: Dramatically improve visualization/monitoring to convey model internals for training excellence, insight, and pedagogy.
acceptance_criteria: - All child visualization tickets closed or explicitly descoped.\n- Epic summary includes links to dashboards, console, probing tools, and storybook; documents how to run them.

acceptance_criteria: - Precision sweep completed: BF16 vs FP16 vs TF32; speed/accuracy deltas recorded.\n- Bio-feature stability validated (no NaNs) under chosen defaults.\n- Documented recommended precision/env flags for train and infer on 4090.

title: CI: lint/type/UBS gate

acceptance_criteria: - All child perf tickets (existing + new) closed or explicitly descoped.\n- Epic summary includes perf wins (tok/s, latency, mem) and recommended configs for dual 4090, plus CI guardrail status.
notes: CI perf guardrails should be paired with lint/type/UBS gates; add when wiring CI.

title: Bio: BDNF metaplasticity state + slow LR modulation
description:
Goal: introduce B(t) accumulator and gamma gain on slow consolidation.
Subtasks:
- Accumulate |ΔW_hebb| with decay; store B state.

acceptance_criteria: - B(t) accumulator stored and logged; gamma gain applied to slow consolidation.\n- Toy pulse-train test shows B rising and LR scaling; no NaNs.\n- Toggle off returns baseline losses unchanged within noise.

title: CORE eval: eval_bundle download 403 -> configurable URL/path
description:
The CORE eval runner (scripts/base_eval.py) currently tries to download eval_bundle.zip from:

- https://karpathy-public.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/eval_bundle.zip

As of 2025-12-18 this URL returns HTTP 403 Forbidden, which blocks all CORE evaluation (including investigation of the SQuAD mismatch).

Work:
- Make the eval bundle source configurable via .env (python-decouple pattern) and/or CLI flags.
- Support a user-supplied local path to either the eval_bundle.zip file or an already-extracted eval_bundle/ directory.
- Improve error handling so a 403 gives a clear next-step message (what to set / where to place files).

Non-goals:
- Do not hardcode secrets or overwrite .env.
acceptance_criteria:
- base_eval can run without the S3 URL by using either a CLI-provided eval bundle path or a decouple-configured URL.
- If download fails (403/404), the error message tells the user exactly how to fix it (env var name + expected path).
- Add/adjust a small test or smoke command in docs verifying the bundle discovery logic.

acceptance_criteria: - All child eval tickets closed or explicitly descoped.\n- Epic summary states measured bio vs vanilla deltas with significance and perf context, and points to dashboard/report.

- Report integrated into dashboards.
acceptance_criteria: - Probing script measures contribution of fast vs slow weights on held-out sequences.\n- Plots decay of fast weights and recall vs distance generated.\n- Results integrated into dashboards/NeuroViz.

title: Perf: 4090 profiling & benchmark harness
description:
Goal: establish reproducible perf harness for dual RTX 4090 (PCIe, no NVLink).
Subtasks:
- Torch benchmarks for train/infer (bio and non-bio) with bs/seq sweep.
- Capture GPU util, mem, SM occupancy via nsight/torch.profiler.
- Scripts to pin GPUs, set env (CUDA_VISIBLE_DEVICES, NCCL_P2P_LEVEL).
- Baseline numbers logged for future regressions.
acceptance_criteria: - Benchmark scripts run on single and dual 4090 with fixed seeds; capture tok/s, latency, GPU util.\n- Profiles saved (torch.profiler/nsight) and referenced in repo docs.\n- Env/launch instructions documented for reproducibility.

title: Bio: Dual sync/async release channels (Doc2)
description:
Goal: split release into synchronous (Syt1) and asynchronous (Doc2) channels.
Subtasks:
- Parallel masked paths; Doc2 gain param; config toggle.
- Tests ensuring async tail present on low calcium; NaN/inf guards.
- Perf regression check.
acceptance_criteria: - Sync and async release terms computed separately with Doc2 gain.\n- Unit test shows async tail on low Ca; disabled path matches baseline.\n- No NaN/inf; perf within 10%.
notes: Raised to P2 to align with other bio toggles; consider sequencing after stochastic release and metaplasticity work.

title: Bio: Stochastic vesicle release kernel + toggle
description:
Goal: add binomial/Gumbel-Sigmoid stochastic release as a configurable path.
Subtasks:
- Add config flag (SynapticConfig) and wire through SynapticPresyn.
- Implement Triton/PyTorch fused sampler; fallback to torch CPU.
- STE/Gumbel-Sigmoid relaxation for training; deterministic path unchanged.
- Unit tests: release mean/var vs analytical; perf regression <10%.
- Docs: README bio section + inline docstring on stochastic path.
acceptance_criteria: - Config flag enables/disables stochastic release path.\n- Unit test covers mean/var vs analytical and deterministic parity when disabled.\n- Benchmark shows <10% slowdown vs deterministic baseline.

title: Xpoll: Knowledge base & playbooks
description:
Goal: persistent knowledge base for cross-project ideas and how-to.
Subtasks:
- Create markdown playbook capturing transfers attempted, outcomes, code pointers.
- FAQ on when to try MGR techniques; link to harness/results.
- Update as prototypes complete.
acceptance_criteria: - Cross-project playbook created: transfers attempted, outcomes, code pointers, FAQs.\n- Links to harness, results, and how-to rerun.\n- Updated after each prototype.

title: Vis: Attention/energy maps & timelines
description:
Goal: produce interpretable attention + bio-energy maps over time.
Subtasks:
- Dump head-wise attention and energy/fatigue overlays for selected steps.
- Tool to render token-level heatmaps and timelines (movie) for sequences.
- Scripts to sample a few batches automatically per epoch; store PNG/MP4.
acceptance_criteria: - Tool renders attention with energy/fatigue overlay per head for sampled steps.\n- Timeline/MP4 export for a chosen sequence; samples auto-collected each epoch.\n- Stored artifacts (PNG/MP4) per run with metadata.

title: CMAES: Phase1 go/no-go summary
description:
Goal: formalize go/no-go after Phase1.
Subtasks:
- Summarize Phase1 results vs thresholds; include cost, seed variance, early-stop triggers.
- Recommendation on Phase2 + scope adjustments.
- Commit summary doc and notify stakeholders.
acceptance_criteria: - Formal go/no-go summary after Phase1: results vs thresholds, costs, seed variance, early-stop outcomes.\n- Recommendation for Phase2 scope; doc shared/committed.

title: CMAES: Sensitivity/ablation of Phase 1 optimum
description:
Goal: OAT reversions vs Phase1 optimum; rank importance.
Subtasks:
- Run revert-each-param evals.
- Produce ranking table/plot; markdown report.
acceptance_criteria: - OAT revert-per-param evals executed on Phase1 optimum.\n- Ranking table/plot produced and stored; markdown report committed.\n- Sensitivity numbers reproducible (seed noted).

title: Eval: Perf contrast bio vs vanilla
description:
Goal: quantify train/infer throughput & memory bio vs vanilla.
Subtasks:
- Run perf harness on key configs (vanilla, bio-all, top ablation).
- Record tok/s, latency, peak mem on dual 4090.
- Summarize deltas and recommend defaults for perf-sensitive users.
acceptance_criteria: - Perf harness runs on vanilla, bio-all, and top ablation configs on dual 4090.\n- Tok/s, latency, peak memory logged; deltas summarized.\n- Recommendations for perf-sensitive users documented.

title: Perf: CI perf guardrail benches
description:
Goal: automated perf regression guard for dual 4090.
Subtasks:
- Choose slim bench matrix (bio/non-bio, short/long seq, train/infer).
- Implement script to run benches and emit json/csv.
- Wire into CI (or manual pre-push hook) with thresholds; fail on >X% regression.
- Store baselines and update process documented.
acceptance_criteria: - Perf CI bench script outputs json/csv and covers agreed matrix.\n- Thresholds enforced (fail on >X% regression); documented update procedure.\n- CI/pre-push run produces green baseline on dual 4090.
notes: Future enhancement: integrate lint/type/UBS checks so CI fails if code health regresses even when perf passes.

title: Eval: Statistical significance & variance
description:
Goal: ensure reported gains are statistically sound.
Subtasks:
- Run 2-3 seeds for key configs; compute mean/std and 95% CI.
- Apply paired tests where applicable (same data order/seed).
- Document methodology and how to flag non-significant deltas.
acceptance_criteria: - 2-3 seeds run for key configs; mean/std and 95% CI computed.\n- Paired testing methodology documented; non-significant deltas flagged.\n- Final report notes which gains are statistically supported.

title: CMAES: Joint 48D final search (conditional)
description:
Goal: full-space CMA-ES if Phase1 gain >10%.
Subtasks:
- Configure pop≈15, gens≈200; apply early-stop rules/patience.
- Track budget; archive best params.
- Final summary of gains vs Phase1.
acceptance_criteria: - Joint 48D CMA-ES configured (pop≈15, gens≈200) and launched only if Phase1 >10% gain.\n- Early-stop/patience applied; budget tracked.\n- Final best_params and delta vs Phase1 summarized.

title: Perf: Nsight recipe & flame atlas
description:
Goal: one-click Nsight Systems/Compute profiling recipe and annotated flame atlas.
Subtasks:
- Script to capture representative trace (train/infer) on 4090.
- Generate annotated flame graph / timeline highlighting bottlenecks.
- Doc how to rerun profile and compare against baseline.
acceptance_criteria: - Scripted Nsight Systems/Compute capture produces reproducible trace on 4090.\n- Annotated flame/timeline shared showing bottlenecks; compared to baseline.\n- Rerun instructions documented for future profiling.

title: Bio: Septin-style local inhibition on logits/router
description:
Goal: windowed lateral inhibition over keys/experts fused into softmax/router.
Subtasks:
- Implement 1D window conv or fused op; strength parameter.
- Stability checks under mixed precision; numerical guard.
- Visualization of sharpening; perf check.
acceptance_criteria: - Inhibition window applied in logits/router when enabled; disabled path unchanged.\n- Numeric stability verified under bfloat16.\n- Visualization shows sharpened attention/router distribution.

title: Epic runbooks (per-epic how-to)
description:
Goal: create one-page runbooks for each epic (bio features, CMA-ES, perf 4090, eval, vis, cross-pollination).
Subtasks:
- Template: scope, prerequisites, commands, artifacts, success criteria, rollback/flags.
- Fill for all current epics; link in repo docs.
acceptance_criteria: - One-page runbooks created for each epic (bio features, CMA-ES, perf 4090, eval, vis, cross-pollination).\n- Template includes scope, prerequisites, commands, artifacts, success criteria, rollback/flags.\n- Runbooks linked in docs.

title: CMAES: Fast proxy objective & LCE
description:
Goal: implement fast proxy objective (short run + learning-curve extrapolation) for cheap candidate screening.
Subtasks:
- Add 10k-step proxy eval path with fixed seed; optional LCE to estimate 50k.
- Validate proxy correlates with full run on 3 sampled points.
- Flag to use proxy in early generations; document tradeoffs.
acceptance_criteria: - Proxy objective (<=10k steps) implemented with optional LCE to 50k estimate.\n- Correlation vs full run measured on 3 candidates; report correlation/err.\n- CLI flag to enable proxy in early gens; defaults documented.
notes: Ready: wire proxy flag into run_optimization script; validates correlation on 3 sample candidates.

title: Bio: Dual-weight fast/slow plasticity path
description:
Goal: split weights into W_fast (high-decay Hebbian) and W_slow (consolidated).
Subtasks:
- Gate W_fast contribution by calcium; periodic consolidation hook to W_slow.
- Config toggle to disable.
- Perf test <15% hit; ablation toggle.
- Unit tests on toy seq: fast cache improves recall without destabilizing slow weights.
acceptance_criteria: - W_fast + W_slow implemented with calcium gate and periodic consolidation.\n- Ablation toggle verified; baseline parity when off.\n- Perf test shows <15% overhead and no numerical instability.

title: Bio: Rab/SNARE code-based routing
description:
Goal: token cargo/Rab codes vs expert t-SNARE/effector codes compatibility score.
Subtasks:
- Add code projections for tokens and experts; compat function with mismatch penalty.
- Initialize codes; incorporate into router logits; logging specialization.
- Tests on specialization diversity; ensure baseline perf not regressed.
acceptance_criteria: - Cargo/Rab vs t-SNARE/effector codes computed and incorporated into routing score.\n- Init scheme documented; router still trains without divergence.\n- Specialization metric shows diversity vs baseline.

title: Xpoll: Shared benchmark harness (bio vs MGR)
description:
Goal: run comparable benchmarks across bio_inspired_nanochat and MGR demos.
Subtasks:
- Define subset of MGR demos and matching nanochat configs.
- Script to launch both (via subprocess) and collect metrics (tok/s, PPL proxy, qualitative scores).
- Output combined CSV; doc how to reproduce.
acceptance_criteria: - Harness script runs selected MGR demos + corresponding nanochat configs; collects metrics to combined CSV.\n- Repro instructions documented; runs on dual 4090 target.\n- CSV committed/archived.

title: Perf: FlexAttention/FlashAttn path evaluation
description:
Goal: evaluate and integrate FlexAttention/FlashAttention for 4090 in both standard and synaptic paths.
Subtasks:
- Compare SDPA vs FlexAttention vs FlashAttn2/3 on 4090 for target seq lens.
- Wire optional path in gpt/gpt_synaptic with config flag; fallbacks intact.
- Measure throughput/latency; choose default for 4090 builds; doc tradeoffs.
acceptance_criteria: - FlexAttention/FlashAttn vs SDPA benchmarks on 4090 for target seq/batch.\n- Config flag switches paths; fallback safe on CPU or older GPU.\n- Recommended default for 4090 recorded with perf deltas.
